page.title: 14ASHDOWN FOREST CONSERVATION
page.content: The safety and welfare of Ashdown Forest are in the care of the 16 strong Board of Conservators, ll elected members and 5 Commoners. There are 650 registered Commoners but only a few use their rights to graze. One member of the Board represents the Lord of the Manor, 8 from the East Sussex County Council and 2 from the Wealden District Council. There is a Forest Superintendent with 4 full-time Rangers. There are 2 permanent workmen and some 16 employed under the Manpower Services Commission, several voluntary Rangers and Information Staff. The Friends of Ashdown Forest and the Commoners lend their whole- hearted support to the Board. All are very active and totally dedicated to the preservation of this supremely beautiful and historic area of East Sussex.
